name: Jun Wang 0002
content: Welcome to Jun Wang's Home Page Jun Wang Chair Professor of Computational Intelligence Room B6413, Academic Building 1 Department of Computer Science College of Science and Engineering City University of Hong Kong Kowloon Tong, Kowloon, Hong Kong Tel:  (852) 34429701  Fax: (852) 34420503 jwang.cs@cityu.edu.hk EXPERIENCE Chair Professor, City University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong, 2016 to present. Professor, The Chinese University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong, 2002 to 2015. Associate Professor, The Chinese University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong, 1995 to 2001. Associate Professor,  University of North Dakota, Grand Forks, North Dakota, USA, 1993-1997. Assistant Professor, University of North Dakota, Grand Forks, North Dakota, 1990-1993. CAD Programmer (part-time), Zagar, Inc., Cleveland, Ohio, 1989-1990. Teaching/Research Assistant (part-time), Case Western Reserve University, Cleveland, Ohio, 1986-1989. Instructor, Dalian Institute of Technology (renamed to Dalian University of Technology in 1988), Dalian, Liaoning, China, 1985-1986. EDUCATION Ph.D. in Systems Engineering, 1991, Case Western Reserve University M.S. in Systems Engineering,  1985, Dalian Institute of Technology (renamed to Dalian University of Technology in 1988) B.S. in Electrical Engineering,  1982, Dalian Institute of Technology (renamed to Dalian University of Technology in 1988) DISTINCTIONS IEEE Fellow, since 2007. IAPR Fellow, since 2012. Neural Networks Pioneer Award, IEEE Computational Intelligence Society, 2014. Changjiang Chair Professorship (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Sponsored by the Ministry of Education of China and Li Ka Shing Foundation of Hong Kong, 2008-2011. Research Excellence Award, The Chinese University of Hong Kong, 2008-2009. Natural Science Award (first class), Shanghai Municipal Government, 2009. IEEE Distinguished Lecturer, IEEE Computational Intelligence Society, 2010-2012, 2013-2015. IEEE Transactions on Neural Networks Outstanding Paper Award, IEEE Computational Intelligence Society, 2011. Outstanding Achievement Award, Asia Pacific Neural Network Assembly, 2011. Natural Science Award (first class), Ministry of Education of China, 2011. RESEARCH INTERESTS Neural computation Computational intelligence Optimization methods Intelligent control Intelligent robotics Intelligent manufacturing Intelligent data processing MAJOR GRANTS General Research Fund: Intelligent motion control and planning of autonomous underwater vehicles, Hong Kong Research Grants Council, 2014-2017. General Research Fund: Neurodynamic approaches to constrained optimization with generalized-convex and multiple-objective functions, Hong Kong Research Grants Council, 2013-2016. General Research Fund: Analysis and design of memristive neurodynamic systems, Hong Kong Research Grants Council, 2011-2013. General Research Fund: Analysis and design of model predictive control based on recurrent neural networks, Hong Kong Research Grants Council, 2009-2012. General Research Fund: Analysis and design of associative memories based on recurrent neural networks, Hong Kong Research Grants Council, 2008-2010. Earmarked Grant: Sequential blind source extraction from instantaneous and convolutive mixtures for ill-conditioned mixing channels, Hong Kong Research Grants Council, 2004-2006. Earmarked Grant: Analysis and design of recurrent neural networks for dynamic optimization subject to nonlinear constraints and their engineering applications, Hong Kong Research Grants Council, 2003-2006. Earmarked Grant: Recurrent neural networks for real-time grasping force optimization of dexterous manipulations using multi-fingered robotic hands, Hong Kong Research Grants Council, 2000-2003. Earmarked Grant: Multilayer recurrent neural networks for real-time optimization and their applications to optimal control of kinematically redundant manipulators,1998-2001. Earmarked Grant: Multilayer recurrent neural networks for synthesizing and optimizing robust linear and nonlinear control systems, Hong Kong Research Council, 1997-2000. Earmarked Grant: Recurrent neural network for solving combinatorial optimization with time-varying parameters and their applications for en-route vehicle guidance in intelligent transportation systems, Hong Kong Research Grants Council, 1996-1999.
